This is not a place you will just happen upon.  It's off the beaten path, but worth finding.  This is very authentic in it's feel and food.  They have a nice wine selection.  The wait staff did not speak English, but we did very well understanding one another.  We had a variety of appetizers...Jubago cured ham (wonderful balance of saltiness and tasty flavor), rock lobster salad (spot on and simple), but, arguably, my favorite was the white beans (tender with a very flavorful sauce).  I had the Vizcaya-style cod fish.  It was surprisingly good.  The texture was great and it was cooked to perfection.  The sauce was also terrific.  I recommend this place, especially if you want down-to-earth, authentic cuisine without the glitz and glam.
